noun.description: A member of a North American people belonging to the Huron nation and originally of Ontario, now living mainly in Oklahoma and Quebec.
The Iroquoian language of the Wyandot.
A domestic chicken of a medium-sized breed.

adjective.description: Relating to the Wyandot people or their language.

origin: Mid 18th century: from French Ouendat, from Huron Wendat.
